intro: Koeleria cheesemanii, commonly known as the Cheeseman's grass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the禾本科 (Poaceae) family, which includes grasses and related plants. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. Its flowers are usually pale green to blue-gray in color, and it produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Koeleria cheesemanii is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife.
